repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Closes #15733.

(Note that the `source` field is already added in #15717).

comment_data.body:
Should we copy the other fields as well? e.g. tags, ...

See https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specification.html#diagnostic for all possible official fields
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,7 +102,8 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
       end_lnum = _end.line,
       end_col = line_byte_from_position(buf_lines, _end.line, _end.character, offset_encoding),
       severity = severity_lsp_to_vim(diagnostic.severity),
-      message = diagnostic.message
+      message = diagnostic.message,
+      code = diagnostic.code,

comment_data.body:
I think that should be fine.

@neovim/lsp any thoughts here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,7 +102,8 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
       end_lnum = _end.line,
       end_col = line_byte_from_position(buf_lines, _end.line, _end.character, offset_encoding),
       severity = severity_lsp_to_vim(diagnostic.severity),
-      message = diagnostic.message
+      message = diagnostic.message,
+      code = diagnostic.code,

comment_data.body: Should we maybe store all of the original raw lsp fields under an `lsp` key? I don't have a strong opinion, but at some point if the information needed for lsp and for our diagnostic API start to diverge we might want to put all of the `lsp` fields separate.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,7 +102,8 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
       end_lnum = _end.line,
       end_col = line_byte_from_position(buf_lines, _end.line, _end.character, offset_encoding),
       severity = severity_lsp_to_vim(diagnostic.severity),
-      message = diagnostic.message
+      message = diagnostic.message,
+      code = diagnostic.code,

comment_data.body: I'd also tend to have some arbitary property bag and within that an `lsp` key, so that we can avoid extending the neovim specific diagnostic structure each time the LSP specification is extended. (Not that it happens often, but to keep it decoupled)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,7 +102,8 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
       end_lnum = _end.line,
       end_col = line_byte_from_position(buf_lines, _end.line, _end.character, offset_encoding),
       severity = severity_lsp_to_vim(diagnostic.severity),
-      message = diagnostic.message
+      message = diagnostic.message,
+      code = diagnostic.code,

comment_data.body:
I had something like `user_data`  in mind (Similar to how it is used in `complete-items`) and nest it further - to avoid making `lsp` a first-class diagnostic item property. 

But no strong opinion.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,15 +102,21 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
       end_lnum = _end.line,
       end_col = line_byte_from_position(buf_lines, _end.line, _end.character, offset_encoding),
       severity = severity_lsp_to_vim(diagnostic.severity),
-      message = diagnostic.message
+      message = diagnostic.message,
+      lsp = {

comment_data.body: Also no strong opinion. Do we anticipate additional things populating this field? I don't know of any off the top of my head, but additional table nesting doesn't heart (apart from code beauty)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,15 +102,21 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
       end_lnum = _end.line,
       end_col = line_byte_from_position(buf_lines, _end.line, _end.character, offset_encoding),
       severity = severity_lsp_to_vim(diagnostic.severity),
-      message = diagnostic.message
+      message = diagnostic.message,
+      lsp = {

comment_data.body:
I don't anticipate needing to attach any other kind of non-LSP related data here, but of course I can't see the future and this would save us a refactor if that ever was the case. So SGTM.

**EDIT:** Maybe plugins can do something interesting with it, so on further thought I think this is a good idea.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,15 +102,21 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
       end_lnum = _end.line,
       end_col = line_byte_from_position(buf_lines, _end.line, _end.character, offset_encoding),
       severity = severity_lsp_to_vim(diagnostic.severity),
-      message = diagnostic.message
+      message = diagnostic.message,
+      lsp = {

comment_data.body:
Could you also add the `data` property? 

```
 /**
      * A data entry field that is preserved between a
      * `textDocument/publishDiagnostics` notification and
      * `textDocument/codeAction` request.
      *
      * @since 3.16.0
      */
    data?: unknown;
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,15 +102,23 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
       end_lnum = _end.line,
       end_col = line_byte_from_position(buf_lines, _end.line, _end.character, offset_encoding),
       severity = severity_lsp_to_vim(diagnostic.severity),
-      message = diagnostic.message
+      message = diagnostic.message,
+      user_data = {
+        lsp = {
+          code = diagnostic.code,
+          codeDescription = diagnostic.codeDescription,
+          tags = diagnostic.tags,
+          relatedInformation = diagnostic.relatedInformation,
+        },

comment_data.body: Oops, not sure how I missed that one.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,15 +102,23 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
       end_lnum = _end.line,
       end_col = line_byte_from_position(buf_lines, _end.line, _end.character, offset_encoding),
       severity = severity_lsp_to_vim(diagnostic.severity),
-      message = diagnostic.message
+      message = diagnostic.message,
+      user_data = {
+        lsp = {
+          code = diagnostic.code,
+          codeDescription = diagnostic.codeDescription,
+          tags = diagnostic.tags,
+          relatedInformation = diagnostic.relatedInformation,
+        },

comment_regular_data.body:
Linux lint issue? Otherwise good to me with the most recent changes.

Edit: nvm

Not sure what's going on with ASAN and TSAN:

```
FAILED: usr/lib/luarocks/rocks-5.1/penlight /home/runner/nvim-deps/usr/lib/luarocks/rocks-5.1/penlight 
cd /home/runner/nvim-deps && /home/runner/nvim-deps/usr/bin/luarocks build penlight 1.5.4-1 CC=/usr/bin/cc LD=/usr/bin/cc
Warning: Failed searching manifest: Failed fetching manifest for https://luarocks.org - Failed downloading https://luarocks.org/manifest-5.1 - /home/runner/.cache/luarocks/https___luarocks.org/manifest-5.1

Error: Could not satisfy dependency luafilesystem: No results matching query were found for Lua 5.1.
Missing dependencies for penlight 1.5.4-1:
   luafilesystem (not installed)

penlight 1.5.4-1 depends on luafilesystem (not installed)
luafilesystem not found for Lua 5.1.
Checking if available for other Lua versions...
Checking for Lua 5.2...
Checking for Lua 5.3...
Checking for Lua 5.4...
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
```

Looks unrelated to these changes.

@gpanders it was just a sporadic test failure with the lua dependencies. I restarted the tests and they all passed.

Did you want these commits squashed?

> Did you want these commits squashed?

Doesn't matter to me, I wrote the commits so that they could all be merged in, but the latter two are pretty small.

repo.name: neovim

title: fix(diagnostic): preserve fields from LSP diagnostics
